content: i was cleaning up my hard drive and stumbled across some lost
footage this is actually from two cameras ago
i think it was like three or four years ago anyway tyranid objective markers
figured why let the footage go to waste so i'll show you how i made these
these are leftover bits from the larger monsters like the
throats and trigons that sort of thing and then these are spikes from a trigon
kit left over the bases i didn't have any on hand at
the time so i just modeled some and 3d printed them real
quick six of them if you're not familiar with warhammer
40k a standard game has six objective markers in it and they are
numbered one through six and the basic idea is to take these
claws these spikes and super glue them on the base the
number of spikes tells you which marker it is
one two three four five or six then i just flopped them with sand so
carefully painting around the spikes with some neat white pva glue
like elmer's and then i use a quick creek construction sand this is a mixed
aggregate goes from very fine to tiny pebble i
would say and once that's totally dry i just
painted on a dark brown base a wet brush helps to really sink into
the sand capillary action takes over for you
and once that's bone dry a simple dry brush with tan
then i airbrushed the spikes to match my tyranid army sort of an orangey reddish
color and hot glued on the larger monster bits
which i had also painted in advance these are purely decorative just for
flavor they don't have any mechanical meaning
and so here's a table i set up way back when with this
camcorder and i've got all six of them out there i've got my ultramarines out
and my tyranids yep so here's marker six i think yep marker six in the middle
and over here is number trigon number five yep a little bit of gloss on
the claws helps to uh shine them up generally
using gloss varnish on miniatures is verboten not a good idea but
for this particular army i wanted them to feel slick and buggy and gross
so that's why you see they are shining a little bit
yeah the effect is particularly good with that claw right there that came out
good and it's very gratifying to use leftover
bits especially those big monster ones i will get this entire tyranid army out
on parade and film it with my nice dslr in the near future
but till then thanks for checking this out i'm weilock make things and play
games
